actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.
Committee on Finance requested executive comment from OMB, International Trade Commission, Office of the U.S. Trade Representative, Treasury Department, State Department, Commerce Department.

official_title: A bill to impose a surcharge duty on the imports of certain foreign countries.

summary.text: Imposes a surcharge duty on any product of a foreign country during the one-year period beginning on April 1 of any calendar year if the United States had a trade balance deficit with such country that exceeded $16,000,000,000 per year for the three preceeding calendar years. Allows for a Presidential exemption of a product from the surcharge duty if the product would be eligible for exemption under specified provisions of the Trade Act of 1974.

titles.title: A bill to impose a surcharge duty on the imports of certain foreign countries.
